name: MariaDB Master Slave
description:
MariaDB is a community-developed, commercially supported fork of the MySQL relational database management system, intended to remain free and open-source software under the GNU GPL. Development is led by some of the original developers of MySQL.
#### License:
* GPL
* LGPL
#### Hardware Requirement:
* By default, 2 VMs with 2 vCPU, 16GB RAM per VM
* Slave configuration multiple replicas(a maximum of 3)
#### Resources Installed:
* MariaDB 10.3
#### Operating System:
* CentOS Linux release 7.6.1810
#### Platform:
* AHV
#### Lifecycle:
* ScaleOut
* ScaleIn
#### Limitations:
* Upgrade not available.
* For evaluation purpose only. Not recommended for production use.
#### Other Instructions:
* Open port 3306 under Firewall/Security group.
author: Nutanix
